skill.name: subagent-driven-development
skill.description: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session
skill.summary: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and workflow templates. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, no environment access, no external commands. Contains defensive review patterns encouraging verification.

content.value_statement: Managing complex implementation plans with multiple tasks is error-prone and time-consuming. Subagent-driven development provides a structured workflow where fresh subagents implement each task, followed by mandatory two-stage review for spec compliance and code quality before marking complete.
actual_capabilities: Dispatches fresh subagent for each independent task
Performs spec compliance review after implementation
Performs code quality review after spec approval
Enforces two-stage review workflow with re-review loops
Maintains session context without subagent pollution
limitations: Requires implementation plan with independent tasks
Requires human to answer subagent questions
Does not parallelize tasks within a single session

use_cases.title: Manage feature implementations
use_cases.description: Break complex features into independent tasks with clear specs for subagent execution

use_cases.title: Iterate on features faster
use_cases.description: Dispatch subagents for implementation tasks while maintaining overall architecture consistency

use_cases.title: Enforce quality standards
use_cases.description: Require spec compliance and code quality reviews before any task is marked complete

prompt_templates.title: Implement task
prompt_templates.prompt: Dispatch implementer subagent with full task text and architectural context from implementer-prompt.md

prompt_templates.title: Review spec
prompt_templates.prompt: Dispatch spec reviewer subagent to verify implementer built exactly what was requested

prompt_templates.title: Review quality
prompt_templates.prompt: Dispatch code quality reviewer after spec compliance passes

prompt_templates.title: Complete workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Dispatch final code reviewer for entire implementation and use superpowers:finishing-a-development-branch

best_practices: Provide full task text and context upfront - do not make subagents read plan files
Answer subagent questions before they proceed - clarify requirements early
Never skip re-review loops - implementer must fix issues then reviewer must re-approve
anti_patterns: Skipping spec compliance or code quality review - quality gates exist for a reason
Dispatching multiple implementation subagents in parallel - causes conflicts and context pollution
Starting code quality review before spec compliance passes - spec compliance must happen first

faq.question: When should I use this skill?
faq.answer: Use when you have an implementation plan with independent tasks and want to stay in the same session while using fresh subagents for each task.

faq.question: How is this different from executing-plans?
faq.answer: Executing-plans opens parallel sessions. Subagent-driven-development keeps you in the same session without context switches.

faq.question: Can tasks depend on each other?
faq.answer: Tasks should be mostly independent. Tightly coupled tasks should be combined or executed manually with the executing-plans skill.

faq.question: Is my data safe with subagents?
faq.answer: Yes. Subagents work within their allocated context. The workflow includes verification steps to ensure subagent work is reviewed.

faq.question: What happens if a subagent fails?
faq.answer: Dispatch a fix subagent with specific instructions. Do not try to fix manually as this causes context pollution.

faq.question: Do I need other skills to use this?
faq.answer: This skill works best with writing-plans for creating plans, requesting-code-review for reviewers, and finishing-a-development-branch for completion.
